intro: Euonymus fortunei f. reticulatus, commonly known as the silver leaf euonymus, is a compact, evergreen shrub characterized by its distinctive, waxy, silver-white leaves that are often mottled with dark green. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring, which are followed by orange-red berries that are ornamental but not edible. It is native to China and is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types. Euonymus fortunei f. reticulatus thrives in partial shade to full sun and is commonly used in landscaping for its dense growth habit and year-round visual interest.
